title: José Viterbo
text:
José Eduardo Dias Borges Viterbo Correia (born 23 March 1962), known as José Viterbo, is a Portuguese <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> who last managed <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Acad%C3%A9mica%20de%20Coimbra%20%E2%80%93%20O.A.F.">Académica</a>.
Coaching career.
Académica.
Viterbo started the 2014–15 season in charge of Académica's under-23 side. On 15 February 2015, however, following <a href="Paulo%20S%C3%A9rgio%20Bento%20Brito">Paulo Sérgio</a> resignation, he was named caretaker manager of the first team.
He made his debut as Académica coach against <a href="G.D.%20Estoril%20Praia">Estoril</a> at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Ant%C3%B3nio%20Coimbra%20da%20Mota">Estádio António Coimbra da Mota</a> on 22 February 2015, in a 1–2 away win for the league.
A few days later, Luís Godinho, the vice-president of Académica, stated in an interview given to MaisFutebol that they are not looking for a manager.
After losing the first five games of the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Primeira%20Liga">2015–16 season</a>, he resigned on 20 September 2015.
